content: What famous author, known for his works on Middle Earth, was also a professor of Anglo-Saxon at Oxford?

J.R.R. Tolkien, the renowned author celebrated for his epic works set in Middle Earth, such as "The Lord of the Rings" and "The Hobbit," indeed held a distinguished academic position. He served as the Rawlinson and Bosworth Professor of Anglo-Saxon at Pembroke College, Oxford, from 1925 to 1945. His expertise in Anglo-Saxon literature and language significantly influenced his imaginative creations, infusing his fictional worlds with rich linguistic and cultural depth.
